bill.title: Financial Technology Innovation and Defense Act
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 6 (Wednesday, January 10, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BUDD:H.R. 4752.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3, providing the power to``regulate commerce with foreign nations, and among theseveral states.''[Page H132]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 57 - 0.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Financial Technology Innovation and Defense Act

To establish an Independent Financial Technology Task Force, to provide rewards for information leading to convictions related to terrorist use of digital currencies, to establish a FinTech Leadership in Innovation Fund to encourage the development of tools and programs to combat terrorist and illicit use of digital currencies, and for other purposes.
Financial Technology Innovation and Defense Act

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Financial Technology Innovation and Defense Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
